Hi Readers!

Do you use a hair band to put your hair up? When your hair isn\'t up, do you wear the hair band around your wrist for safe keeping until you do want to put your hair up? Then instead of just having it on your wrist, why not make it look funky and cool! This eBook will show you a few different styles for using hair bands to decorate your hand and wrist, with step-by-step guides on how to create each one.
When you\'ve mastered each style in this book you can visit our blog at BandItGuide.blogspot.com and find even more funky cool designs. You can even submit your own creative styles!
Have fun, stay safe, and get to creating!
Sincerely,
Joni Riley-Gardner

Always make sure your bands are never too tight and cut off circulation. If they do this, please remove the band immediately and choose a different band that is a little looser. When wearing these styles also be aware that they can catch on things, just like when you wear them around your wrist. Now, throughout the book we will use this diagram to help explain the process for making each style: (all instructions are written for creating designs on your left hand)
First, we\'ll start out showing you how to connect two bands. (You\'ll use this process a lot when creating most of the styles.)
Step 1: Lay both bands so that they are overlapping.
Step 2: Pinch together the opposite sides of the band on bottom so that it curves around the other band.
Step 3: Grab the band on the right by the loop on top and pull it under the bottom loop.
Step 4: Pull the loop all the way through until the right band is snug around the left band.
If you flip it over, it will look like this:

* If you pull the right band too much it will change the look of the knot. Throughout this book we will use the knot above, however feel free to use whichever look you like best! You can also visit our blog at BandItGuide.blogspot.com to check out other styles of knots that you can use.
Basic 1
Basic 2
Basic 3
Basic 4
Basic 5
For this style you would follow Steps 1-4 of the Basic Set Up.
Step 5: Loop one of the bands over your pinky.
Step 6: Loop the other band around your thumb.
Bridge 1
Follow Steps 1-4 of the Basic Set Up. Then:
Step 5: Take one of the bands and wrap it around your wrist so that the knot is on top of your arm and the other band is lying on top of your hand.
Step 6: Loop the other band around your wrist as well.
Step 7: Spread the bands out to your desired length. Easy peasy!
XMarks 1
XMarks 2
If you\'ve already done the X Marks the Spot style this one will be easy too! Just follow Steps 1-4 of the Basic Set Up.
Step 5: Wrap one of the bands around your wrist.
Step 6: Take the other band and wrap it around your thumb, or any of your other fingers.
Wrestler 1
This is a continuation of our previous style. Start by following Steps 1-5 of Thumb Wrestler.
Step 6: Take the other band and wrap it around any two fingers.
Trapped 1
Here\'s another easy one using the Basic Set Up, just follow Steps 1-4.
Step 5: Wrap one of the bands around your wrist.
Step 6: Take the other band and twist it a couple of times, then wrap it around one of your fingers.
Twisted 1
For this style, follow Steps 1-4 of the Basic Set Up. (Have you noticed yet that we use this basic set up a lot?)
Step 5: Wrap one of the bands around your wrist so that the other band lies on the palm side of your hand (instead of the back of your hand).
Step 6: Wrap the other band around your middle finger, and done! (You can also wrap the band around any of your other fingers to slightly change up the look.)
Ring 1
Let\'s make a cute bow! First, use Step 1 and Step 2 of the Basic Set Up.
Step 3: Grasp the opposite sides of the band on the right and create two \'bunny ears\'. (Yep, we\'re going to use the kindergarten version of tying shoelaces to get our bow tied!)
Step 4: Overlap the two bunny ears (to make an \'X\').
Step 5: Take one of the ears and wrap it around the other, then pull it through the hole (or bottom of the \'X\').
Step 6: Pull the bow tight so you don\'t lose it! Then place the band (the one now holding the bow tie) on your wrist.
Bow Tie 1
Bow Tie 2
Use Steps 1-4 of the Basic Set Up.

Step 5: Take the third band and loop it around the first band in the same way you did the second band (so that the second and third bands are about 2 inches apart, or whichever amount of spacing you desire).
Step 6: Place band 1 over your wrist so that bands 2 and 3 are lying on top of your hand.
Step 7: Wrap band 2 around your middle finger.
Step 8: Wrap band 3 around the same finger.
Step 9: Shift the bands so that they lay as you like.
Tower 1
Tower 2
This is a continuation of our previous style. Start by following Steps 1-6 of Eiffel Tower.
Step 7: Wrap bands 2 and 3 around different fingers.
The W 1
Use Steps 1-4 of the Basic Set Up.
Step 5: Take band 3 and loop it around the first band in the same way you did band 2 (however, knot it on the opposite side of band 1 across from band 2).
Step 6: Wrap band 1 around your wrist.
Step 7: Wrap band 2 around your thumb.
Step 8: Wrap band 3 around your pinky.
Step 9: Shift the bands so that they lay as you like. Here’s how it should look:
Flanked 1
Flanked 2
This is a continuation of our previous style. Start by following Steps 1-9 of Flanked.
Step 10: Make two simple adjustments, by moving the two knots closer together.
Closing 1
This one is basically like the Simply Twisted style but with a third band added. First, follow Steps 1-4 of the Basic Set Up.
Step 5: Take band 3 and loop it around band 1 right next to band 2.
Step 6: Wrap band 1 around your wrist so that band 2 and 3 lay on top of your hand.
Step 7: Take band 2 and twist it a couple of times then wrap it around your index finger.
Step 8: Take band 3 and twist it a couple of times then wrap it around your pinky finger.
(You can change this one up too! Just move bands 2 and 3 to different fingers, or wear them on the same finger.)
Two 1
Two 2
This is one of my favorites! Again, you will use Steps 1-4 of the Basic Set Up.
Step 5: Loop band 3 around band 2 using the same method as when you looped band 2 around band 1.
Step 6: Wrap band 1 around your wrist so that band 2 and 3 lay on the top of your hand.
Step 7: Wrap band 2 around your index finger.
Step 8: Wrap band 3 around your pinky finger.
Crowd 1
Crowd 2
Let\'s get twisted with this one too! Follow Steps 1-7 of 3\'s A Crowd.
Step 8: Twist band 3 and wrap it around your pinky finger.
Crowd Twist 1
Do you know what the first steps are? Yep, this again: Follow Steps 1-4 of the Basic Set Up.
Step 5: Loop band 3 around the knot that band 1 and 2 make together, in the same style loop that you used putting band 2 on band 1. It\'s a little tricky, but keep trying and you’ll get it!
Step 6: Wrap band 1 around your thumb.
Step 7: Wrap band 2 around your pinky.
Step 8: Wrap band 3 around your middle finger.
Spider 1
Spider 2
First, follow Steps 1-5 of Spider Web.
Step 6: Wrap band 3 around your wrist so that band 1 and 2 lay on top of your hand.
Step 7: Wrap band 2 around your thumb.
Step 8: Wrap band 1 around your pinky finger, and done!
Webbed 1
Get your basic set up ready by using Steps 1-4 of the Basic Set Up.
Step 5: Take band 3 and loop it around the first band in the same way you did band 2 (however, knot it on the opposite side of band 1 across from band 2).
Step 6: Wrap band 3 around your wrist so that bands 1 and 2 lay on top of your hand.
Step 7: Wrap band 2 around your wrist also.
Step 8: Let band 2 be around your wrist and band 3 be farther down your forearm so that band 1 is stretched out.
Chic Cuff 1
Chic Cuff 2
Time to get twisted again! Create this style by following Steps 1-6 of the Chic Cuff.
Step 7: Twist band 1 a few times, then wrap band 2 around your wrist as well.
Step 8: Let band 2 be around your wrist and band 3 be farther down your forearm so that band 1 is stretched out.
Make sure your bands are tight enough that they hold in place (but remember: not too tight that they cut off circulation!)
Twisted Cuff 1
